docs.lead_paragraph: Left-wing attacks on an imperfect program could undermine progressives’ interests.
docs.abstract: Paul Krugman Op-Ed column laments that many progressives have joined conservatives in trashing Pres Obama's Affordable Care Act; argues Bernie Sanders's insistence on single-payer system is fueling liberal critique, which has several valid points but also several misguided ones; warns general election will be referendum on whether to preserve real if incomplete progress made under Obama.
docs.snippet: Left-wing attacks on an imperfect program could undermine progressives’ interests.

docs.lead_paragraph: About 12.7 million people signed up for health coverage under the Affordable Care Act or had their coverage renewed in the third annual open enrollment season.

headline.main: Health Care Signups Exceed Hopes, With 4 Million Newcomers to Federal Marketplace
headline.print_headline: Health Care Signups Exceed Hopes, With 4 Million Newcomers to Federal Marketplace

docs.abstract: Health and Human Services Dept reports around 12.7 million people signed up for or renewed health insurance under Affordable Care Act during third open enrollment season since law’s passage; four million people who signed up were new to federal health insurance marketplace in 2016.
docs.snippet: About 12.7 million people signed up for health coverage under the Affordable Care Act or had their coverage renewed in the third annual open enrollment season.

docs.lead_paragraph: About 12.7 million Americans signed up for 2016 health insurance coverage through the government insurance exchanges, surpassing its expectations, U.S. Health and Human Services Secretary Sylvia Burwell said on Thursday.

headline.main: U.S. Signs Up 12.7 Million Americans for Obamacare Health Insurance
headline.print_headline: U.S. Signs Up 12.7 Million Americans for Obamacare Health Insurance

docs.snippet: About 12.7 million Americans signed up for 2016 health insurance coverage through the government insurance exchanges, surpassing its expectations, U.S. Health and Human Services Secretary Sylvia Burwell said on Thursday.

docs.lead_paragraph: Still facing political jeopardy, President Barack Obama's health care law beat expectations by earning solid sign-ups this year, according to figures released Thursday by the administration.

headline.main: Obama Health Care Law Posts Respectable Sign-Up Season
headline.print_headline: Obama Health Care Law Posts Respectable Sign-Up Season

docs.snippet: Still facing political jeopardy, President Barack Obama's health care law beat expectations by earning solid sign-ups this year, according to figures released Thursday by the administration.

docs.lead_paragraph: As Gov. Matt Bevin prepares to remake Kentucky's Medicaid program, a new national survey shows what's at stake: gains in insurance coverage matched only by one other state.

docs.lead_paragraph: Vermont Sen. Bernie Sanders opened up a new line of attack in the Democratic presidential primary on Wednesday, putting Hillary Clinton on the defensive over her liberal credentials just days after she eked a slim victory in the Iowa caucuses.

headline.main: Clinton Defends Progressive Record Against Sanders Critique
headline.print_headline: Clinton Defends Progressive Record Against Sanders Critique
